5  AI Notebook Features

Author

Gerd Graßhoff

Published

January 15, 2025

6 Label System

6.1 Basic Usage

Store a response with a label:

---
model: gemini-pro
label: my_analysis
---
Analyze this text...

Reference within same notebook:

---
model: claude-haiku
---
Improve this analysis: {{my_analysis}}

6.2 Cross-Notebook References

Reference responses from other notebooks:

---
model: gemini-pro
---
Compare:
1. {{notebook1:analysis_1}}
2. {{notebook2:analysis_2}}

7 Processing Behavior

  • overwrite: false (default): Skip if response exists
  • overwrite: true: Always process
  • Labels update even when blocks are skipped
  • Cross-references resolve before processing

8 Example Project

historical-analysis/
├── notebooks/
│   ├── document1.qmd
│   ├── document2.qmd
│   └── comparison.qmd
├── process/
│   ├── document1.json
│   ├── document2.json
│   └── comparison.json
└── ai-views/
    ├── document1-vis.qmd
    ├── document2-vis.qmd
    └── comparison-vis.qmd

# Label System

## Basic Usage

Store a response with a label:

```yaml
---
model: gemini-pro
label: my_analysis
---
Analyze this text...
```

Reference within same notebook:

```yaml
---
model: claude-haiku
---
Improve this analysis: {{my_analysis}}
```

## Cross-Notebook References

Reference responses from other notebooks:

```yaml
---
model: gemini-pro
---
Compare:
1. {{notebook1:analysis_1}}
2. {{notebook2:analysis_2}}
```

# Processing Behavior

- `overwrite: false` (default): Skip if response exists
- `overwrite: true`: Always process
- Labels update even when blocks are skipped
- Cross-references resolve before processing

# Example Project

```
historical-analysis/
├── notebooks/
│   ├── document1.qmd
│   ├── document2.qmd
│   └── comparison.qmd
├── process/
│   ├── document1.json
│   ├── document2.json
│   └── comparison.json
└── ai-views/
    ├── document1-vis.qmd
    ├── document2-vis.qmd
    └── comparison-vis.qmd
```
